Title: EU streamlines strategy to cut Russian gas imports by 2027 with new proposal
Description: The European Commission has proposed a revised strategy for the EU’s complete phase-out of Russian gas and oil imports by the end of 2027.
Author: JS

Title: Commonwealth LNG confirms 20-year SPA with Petronas
Description: Petronas, via its subsidiary Petronas LNG, has entered an LNG sales and purchase agreement (SPA) to purchase 1 mtpa of LNG from the proposed 9.5 mtpa Commonwealth LNG export project in Cameron, Louisiana, for 20 years.
Author: JS

Title: LNG tankers idle off Oman amid rising Strait of Hormuz security risks
Description: Continued regional tensions between Israel and Iran have intensified in recent weeks, creating ripple effects that are now most visible in the Strait of Hormuz, where several LNG tankers are now idling or diverting amid growing security concerns.
Author: JS

Title: Electronic interference in Mideast Gulf disrupts LNG tracking as regional tensions escalate
Description: A surge in electronic signal jamming across the Middle East Gulf — particularly near Qatar’s Ras Laffan LNG terminal — has severely disrupted LNG tanker tracking since June 14, complicating real-time visibility  as tensions escalate between Iran and Israel.
Author: CK

Title: Plaquemines receives first LNG carrier at third jetty following regulatory greenlight
Description: Venture Global’s Plaquemines LNG plant in Louisiana has received the first LNG ship at its third jetty, almost two weeks after securing regulatory approval to commission the infrastructure.
Author: CK

Title: Kansai Electric to halt Takahama 4 reactor until late September; Kyushu’s Genkai 3 to restart normal operations in July
Description: Japanese power utility Kansai Electric Power will shut its 870 MW Takahama Unit 4 reactor on June 18 for a scheduled regular inspection expected to last through late September, with full operations set to resume in late October.
Author: CK
